CK^ a n 4I"CABINET.-----^461k 486 (25).IRISH BOUNDARY COMMISSION.The following letter from Sir Maurice Hanksy to the Secretary of the Irish Boundary Commission is circulated to the Cabinet by direction of the Prime Minister.Offices of the Cabinet,2 Whitehall Gardens, 8.W. 1.20th November, 1925.Sir,I am directed "by the Prime Minister to refer to your 0letter of November 6th in which you state that the Commission consider it desirable that they should have an opportunity .465(25) 0g oon:ferring. on certain points with a representative ofHis Majesty1 s Government and of the Government of the Irish Pree State, and to say that His Majesty'a Government will be glad to confer with the Commission as suggested.His Majesty1S Government understand that the date most convenient to the Commission is November 24th. That date is convenient to His Majesty1s Government, and I am to suggest therefore that the Conference should be held at the Commission's Office on that date at 11-30 a.m.It appears to His Majesty"s Government that it may be advantageous that they should be represented at tho Conference by more than one representative, and I am to enquire whether the Commission would have any objection to this course. If not, their representatives will bethe Secretary of State for Dominion Affairs, the Secretary of State for the Home Department and the Attorney General accompanied by not more than threo officials.Phe Secretary, I am, etc,Irish Boundary Commission, 6 Clements Inn, W.C. 2.(Sd) M.P.A. HANKSY.
